Sentencas: Cation-stoichiometric and strontium-deficient Sr1-xCexTiO3 +/-delta (0<0.15) have been appraised using controlled-atmosphere dilatometry, thermogravimetric analysis, and measurements of total conductivity and Seebeck coefficient in the oxygen partial pressure range from 10 (20) to 0.5 atm at 650 degrees-950 degrees C. As for other donor-doped titanates, perovskite-type Sr1-xCexTiO3 +/-delta exhibit predominant n-type electronic conductivity and slow changes in the charge-compensation mechanism on reduction, associated with kinetically stagnated diffusion.
Titulo: Electrical Properties and Dimensional Stability of Ce-Doped SrTiO3-δ for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Applications

Sentencas: The resultant hysteresis and kinetic stabilization of nonequilibrium states make it possible to substantially increase the conductivity by preliminary reduction at high temperatures, such as 1350 degrees C.
Titulo: Electrical Properties and Dimensional Stability of Ce-Doped SrTiO3-δ for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Applications

Sentencas: Owing to relatively small variations in the defect concentrations, the chemically induced expansion of Ce-substituted titanate ceramics is very low, while the thermal expansion at 130 degrees-1100 degrees C is almost linear and essentially P-O2 independent.
Titulo: Electrical Properties and Dimensional Stability of Ce-Doped SrTiO3-δ for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Applications

Sentencas: The average thermal expansion coefficients vary in the narrow range (11-12) x 10(-6) K-1, compatible with common solid oxide electrolytes.
Titulo: Electrical Properties and Dimensional Stability of Ce-Doped SrTiO3-δ for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Applications

Sentencas: All of these properties make the material an attractive choice as a solid oxide fuel cell anode material.
Titulo: Electrical Properties and Dimensional Stability of Ce-Doped SrTiO3-δ for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Applications

Sentencas: However, the nature of the reduced, highly conductive, state appears to be metastable and may not be completely recoverable after redox cycling.
Titulo: Electrical Properties and Dimensional Stability of Ce-Doped SrTiO3-δ for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Applications
